body:
Sorry, I should also mention I'm on 64-bit Windows 10. Here are the browser versions I'm using:

Chrome: 47.0.2526.111 m
IE: 11.63.10586.0
Edge: 25.10586.0.0
Firefox: 44.0

> @seven-phases-max:
> Anyone to confirm?

Confirmed.

If an SVG image defines an intrinsic ratio in any way, then Firefox will honor it when the SVG is used as a background image; even when the SVG in question is configured with `preserveAspectRatio="none"`.

The only way to override that is to set an explicit `background-size : 100%`.

(See: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/Scaling_of_SVG_backgrounds)

The jsfiddle in question has a (decoded and pretty-printed) SVG source of:

``` svg
<?xml version="1.0" ?>
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" version="1.1"
  width="100%" height="100%" viewBox="0 0 1 1" preserveAspectRatio="none"
>
  <linearGradient id="gradient" gradientUnits="userSpaceOnUse"
    x1="0%" y1="0%" x2="100%" y2="0%"
  >
    <stop offset="0%" stop-color="#f6f7f8"/>
    <stop offset="100%" stop-color="#d0d1d5"/>
  </linearGradient>
  <rect x="0" y="0" width="1" height="1" fill="url(#gradient)" />
</svg>
```

Its viewbox is setting up an intrinsic ratio, which is not what you'd want. It also contains quite a bit of unnecessary noise that can be stripped out to shrink the SVG down in size.

Here's what that SVG _should_ be:

``` svg
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <linearGradient id="g" x1="0%" y1="0%" x2="100%" y2="0%">
    <stop offset="0%" stop-color="#f6f7f8"/>
    <stop offset="100%" stop-color="#d0d1d5"/>
  </linearGradient>
  <rect width="100%" height="100%" fill="url(#g)" />
</svg>
```

And the resulting fiddle: https://jsfiddle.net/vb088x4b/

Workaround background-size: 100%; not work.
The only workaround worked for me is background-size: 100vw 100vh
Saw this was still open. Should `svg-gradient` be deprecated and this be marked as "won't fix"?

`svg-gradient` may still serve a purpose for those users that need to support IE 9, which supports SVG backgrounds and SVG gradients, but doesn't support CSS gradients.

Still; that use-case could also be — and _probably_ should be — resolved with a custom post-compile step, like auto-prefixer handling vendor prefixing.
@rjgotten Oh I'm not suggesting we drop `svg-gradient` immediately, just deprecate it. And considering the low need, I think addressing this bug is pretty low priority.

~~Also, AFAIK, `xmlns` is not really a requirement for any browser.~~

Never mind, seems it is!

issue.title: svg-gradient scale problem in less 3.6+
issue.body:
Apparently after fixing #2791 (firefox bug with svg-gradient) we got a new problem

**TL;DR:**
https://codepen.io/thybzi/pen/omyBQq

**Longer description:**
SVG code generated now differs in some way, and it results in a "square" generated picture (no more "any aspect ratio" usage available).

So, when used with combination with `background-size: 100% @myvalue`, it comes out as "small gradientish square in the middle"

I think it should work exactly as linear-gradient in the same case. But now it doesn't:
https://codepen.io/thybzi/pen/omyBQq

**Code examples:**

less code:
```less
svg-gradient(
    to bottom,
    fade(#05070a, 0%) 0%,
    fade(#05070a, 2.6%) 10%,
    fade(#05070a, 4.55%) 20%,
    fade(#05070a, 8.45%) 30%,
    fade(#05070a, 14.3%) 40%,
    fade(#05070a, 19.5%) 50%,
    fade(#05070a, 65%) 100%
)
```
svg-gradient result, old variant (pre 3.6):
```
data:image/svg+xml,<%3Fxml%20version%3D"1.0"%20%3F><svg%20xmlns%3D"http%3A%2F%2Fwww.w3.org%2F2000%2Fsvg"%20version%3D"1.1"%20width%3D"100%25"%20height%3D"100%25"%20viewBox%3D"0%200%201%201"%20preserveAspectRatio%3D"none"><linearGradient%20id%3D"gradient"%20gradientUnits%3D"userSpaceOnUse"%20x1%3D"0%25"%20y1%3D"0%25"%20x2%3D"0%25"%20y2%3D"100%25"><stop%20offset%3D"0%25"%20stop-color%3D"%2305070a"%20stop-opacity%3D"0"%2F><stop%20offset%3D"10%25"%20stop-color%3D"%2305070a"%20stop-opacity%3D"0.026000000000000002"%2F><stop%20offset%3D"20%25"%20stop-color%3D"%2305070a"%20stop-opacity%3D"0.0455"%2F><stop%20offset%3D"30%25"%20stop-color%3D"%2305070a"%20stop-opacity%3D"0.0845"%2F><stop%20offset%3D"40%25"%20stop-color%3D"%2305070a"%20stop-opacity%3D"0.14300000000000002"%2F><stop%20offset%3D"50%25"%20stop-color%3D"%2305070a"%20stop-opacity%3D"0.195"%2F><stop%20offset%3D"100%25"%20stop-color%3D"%2305070a"%20stop-opacity%3D"0.65"%2F><%2FlinearGradient><rect%20x%3D"0"%20y%3D"0"%20width%3D"1"%20height%3D"1"%20fill%3D"url(%23gradient)"%20%2F><%2Fsvg>
```
svg-gradient result, new variant (3.6+):
```
data:image/svg+xml,<svg%20xmlns%3D"http%3A%2F%2Fwww.w3.org%2F2000%2Fsvg"%20viewBox%3D"0%200%201%201"><linearGradient%20id%3D"g"%20x1%3D"0%25"%20y1%3D"0%25"%20x2%3D"0%25"%20y2%3D"100%25"><stop%20offset%3D"0%25"%20stop-color%3D"%2305070a"%20stop-opacity%3D"0"%2F><stop%20offset%3D"10%25"%20stop-color%3D"%2305070a"%20stop-opacity%3D"0.026000000000000002"%2F><stop%20offset%3D"20%25"%20stop-color%3D"%2305070a"%20stop-opacity%3D"0.0455"%2F><stop%20offset%3D"30%25"%20stop-color%3D"%2305070a"%20stop-opacity%3D"0.0845"%2F><stop%20offset%3D"40%25"%20stop-color%3D"%2305070a"%20stop-opacity%3D"0.14300000000000002"%2F><stop%20offset%3D"50%25"%20stop-color%3D"%2305070a"%20stop-opacity%3D"0.195"%2F><stop%20offset%3D"100%25"%20stop-color%3D"%2305070a"%20stop-opacity%3D"0.65"%2F><%2FlinearGradient><rect%20x%3D"0"%20y%3D"0"%20width%3D"1"%20height%3D"1"%20fill%3D"url(%23g)"%20%2F><%2Fsvg>
```
